inn1.comm: full on leg stump, a bit of late outswing, and Guptill shows a full face to block that to mid-on
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
outswing from a nice length just outside off, and Guptill leaves it alone
again, lovely line outside off, nice full length and late shape away. Guptill does well not to flirt at it
a little fuller and closer to off stump, and Guptill gets forward, lets it come to him, and defends very close to his body

and Steyn starts with a maiden. Superb over, pretty much everything on a perfect length on or outside off, and everything demanding the utmost respect. This is another off-stump outswinger, and Guptill gets forward to defend into the off side

good length ball on off stump. Neesham plays for the angle, looking to defend towards mid-off, and a little bit of movement into him causes him to get an inside edge down towards deep backward square leg
that's a super delivery, angling in towards off stump, hits the seam and straightens and beats Guptill's bat as he pokes forward to defend
this is slightly back of  a length outside off, wobbles a bit after Guptill chooses to leave
a little wider outside off, easier leave this time for Guptill
a touch short, and a bit of width, but it doesn't quite come on as he slaps this off the back foot and point dives to his right to stop that
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended off the front foot
full and wide, and he flashes at it without too much footwork and slices it down to third man
full, angling in towards off stump, punched to mid-on
and now Guptill is off the mark, Steyn is a touch too straight, and he clips it off middle and leg down to deep backward square leg
length ball, angled across a little wide of off, and Neesham lets it go
full, wide, and this time he gets a nice front-foot stride in to drive it through square-ish cover
better line now, angling across towards off stump, and Neesham defends back to the bowler
inswinger, misses the mark, and slants down the leg side
back of a length outside off, Guptill lets it go
a bit of inswing again, and Guptill can't connect with the flick. Off the pad down to deep backward square leg
full, swinging from middle to off, Neesham tucks it away to midwicket
back of a length, swinging away from Neesham, and he steers it with a straight bat to the left of third man
full now, on middle and off, and mid-on has to throw himself to his right to stop that firm drive down the ground
on the pads, swinging towards middle and off, and he blocks it to midwicket, ensuring he doesn't close the face on it too much
drifts onto the pads, and Guptill misses the flick again. Runs off the pad down to fine leg

full on middle and off, and Neesham drives it wide of midwicket, and it runs away to the boundary even though he didn't time it or even hit it where he wanted it to go. I think he wanted to hit that down the ground, but the late inswing turned his bat in his hands
full, too wide, and Neesham drives sweetly to the right of short cover
another good-looking drive off a wide ball outside off, straight to mid-off this time
length ball, angling across, and he drives this on the up to cover
what a ball! It was full, and it swung in towards Neesham's off stump, and then left him off the pitch and beat his bat as he looked to drive through the off side
that's the wide, tempting outswinger, not full enough to drive, and Guptill lets it go
back of a length, straightens on off stump with a bit of extra bounce, and it goes off the shoulder of Guptill's bat down to third man as he looks to defend. Was squared up a touch

beauty. Neesham was looking to defend into the covers, playing for the ball swinging in to him, but it kept going with the angle across and kissed his outside edge through to the keeper. Superb length too, and he was in that halfway forward position as he poked at the ball
length ball quite wide outside off, and Brownlie lets it go
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, poked away to point
superb delivery to end the over. Left him off the seam outside off, and beat his outside edge as he poked at it with no footwork. Such a testing length as well, once again
back of a length, on the stumps, and Guptill shuffles across and works it off his hips down to deep backward square leg

length ball on off stump, curls away just a touch, and Brownlie plays at it with hands only, and no feet, looking maybe to play it to mid-on, and ends up hitting it towards point off the outside half of his bat
back of a length outside off, good-looking punch to the left of short cover
straighter and fuller this time, and Brownlie plays the initial line, looking to work it leg side, and the ball swings away and goes off pad and away towards the slips
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length once again, and that's a lovely punch, very well timed, but the man at cover dives to his left and stops the ball dead
back of a length on the stumps, worked away off the hips towards square leg

fuller now, angling in towards middle and swinging away late, and Guptill's bat comes down at an angle, as he looks to drive to mid-on, and the ball goes uppishly off his outside edge towards mid-off but drops well short of the fielder
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, dies on its way to the keeper after Guptill leaves again
on the pads, and Guptill does well to push it towards mid-on and call Brownlie through for a single quickly and decisively
stays back to a length ball on off stump, pushes it towards mid-off
angles this down leg, and that's another leg bye as Guptill is late on the flick. Off the pads and it  drops into the leg side
hangs back on the back foot again as this straightens on off stump, and defends down the pitch, towards the on side. Overstepped quite a bit, did Morkel
free hit, and Brownlie clears his front leg and swats this length ball from off stump over the deep square leg boundary
dropped, was it? Not sure it carried. It was short, a bit of width, and Faf at backward point dives forward and picked up that cut on the half-volley

back of a length on middle stump, and Brownlie bunted it towards midwicket and ran, but Guptill didn't start at all. McLaren misfielded, however, and New Zealand escape from what might have been a dangerous situation
fuller now, pushed to mid-on with soft hands and that's a much easier single
fullish ball on off stump, driven to short cover
lots of outswing from a full length outside off, and Guptill throws his bat at it and can't connect

whoops. This was always going to look bad on the scorecard if he didn't carry on and play a long innings. Guptill goes after another outswinger, this time closer to off stump. He was looking to hit over mid-on, maybe, and it takes his outside edge through to the keeper. Poor choice of shot, and the pressure of all those dot balls seems to have gotten to him
and here's Philander, who's been phenomenal today. That was on that nasty in-between length just outside off and it wobbled away off the seam and beat McCullum as he poked at it from halfway forward
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot to mid-on
length ball outside off, lots of bounce through to de Kock, who takes it above his head after McCullum lets go

oooh, was there an edge there? Big appeal for a caught behind down the leg side as McCullum shuffles across and fails to connect properly with a flick off the hips. Either goes off his thigh pad alone or off inside edge onto thigh pad, through to the keeper. Given not out, and South Africa don't review. Good decision too. No bat on it at all.
full on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
shortish ball outside off, and Brownlie is beaten looking to cut. He really threw his bat at that.
too full, too straight, and that's timed away beautifully off the pads. He's good to watch when he plays these shots because he stands so straight and still at the crease
on the pads again, and that's another good-looking clip to the midwicket boundary
back of a length outside off, and he punches it down to point
back of a length, too straight once again, and it's tucked down to deep backward square leg
back of a length, looking for the inswinger and his radar goes a little wrong, curls away down the leg side
back of a length outside off, and once again it carries through quite high to the keeper after McCullum leaves
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-off
a bit of bounce from a good length on off stump, and McCullum defends down the pitch with an awkward jab of his bat. Was in a poor position, having got his front foot across
wow. It was a perfectly good length ball outside off, and he simply swung his bat through the line and launched it over the bowler's head. Bounced just short of the sightscreen
and another. Philander shortened his length, and McCullum said thank you very much and pulled it away over the deep midwicket boundary
back to that in-between length outside off, and McCullum lets it go through to the keeper
length ball on off stump, and Brownlie comes forward and dabs it towards point
pushed through quicker, angled in towards off, and Brownlie stays back and punches it down to long-off
shortish ball, googly, spins down the leg side and he pulls it down to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, clubbed down to long-on
full now, on middle stump, and he drives it down to long-on, past short midwicket who dived over the ball
another single, drifts onto the pads, and it's clipped down to deep square leg
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone
on the pads, and he works it away forward of square leg
full, angling in towards leg stump, and McCullum stays in his crease and pokes it away to midwicket
back of a length, off the thigh pad and drops into the leg side as he shuffles across and misses the flick
back of a length on middle stump, clipped away to deep square leg
full and wide, and he drives uppishly but safely, on the bounce down to deep cover
in the blockhole on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
goes back to this length ball on middle stump, and works it away to deep midwicket. This is a slow pitch, and batsmen have lots of time if they stay on the back foot
length ball on off stump, comes forward to defend

was that an edge? It was quicker and it slipped past, or kissed, Brownlie's outside edge as he poked at it from halfway forward, beaten more by pace than the turn, and it's given not out after de Kock went up for the caught behind. South Africa have reviewed... aaand Snicko shows a noise as it passes the bat... HotSpot doesn't show anything, though. It sounded out, Snicko thought so too, so does the third umpire, and so does Chris Gaffaney on the field. Brownlie has to go.
back of a length on middle and off, googly, worked away off the back foot, against the turn towards midwicket
quicker and fuller on off stump, Latham gets a good stride out to defend back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, and he's on the hop as he blocks it down the pitch
fuller now, angling in towards off stump, and McCullum presses forward to defend
shortish ball outside off, and McCullum is beaten by the extra bounce as he leans back to cut

gone! McCullum's looked very eager to pull, and he went for the shot even though it was head-high and he had to drag it from outside off. Doesn't control it at all, and the man at deep backward square leg takes the simplest of catches

and that's two in two. Anderson had only just marked out his guard, and Morkel's slipped one through him. It was back of a length, angling away, and Anderson's feet were stuck in nowhere-land, and his bat caught in the zone between prodding and leaving. In the end, the bat went nowhere and the ball hit his inside edge and crashed into the stumps. This is not looking good for New Zealand
looks for the yorker, it's pretty accurate, on off stump, and Ronchi played it well, clipping it away to mid-on
low full-toss on off stump, punched down to long-on
googly, spins in sharply from outside off. Ronchi stays on the back foot and plays it with the spin towards midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped away towards deep midwicket
another googly, spins away from back of a length, and Latham steers it away towards deep point
back of a length outside off, steered away to deep point
quicker and fuller on off stump, Latham is forward to defend to the bowler

back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Ronchi pokes at it from the crease, and gets a thick outside edge that runs away past de Villiers, who dived to his right at second slip, and past Steyn, throwing himself to his left at third man
lots of bounce just outside off and Ronchi lifts his bat over his head to let it go
back of a length, angling in and bouncing up towards the rib-cage, and he gets on his toes to keep that down on the leg side
shortish ball outside off, left alone

fuller now, a bit of width outside off, and Ronchi comes forward and chips that over mid-off, just extends his arms and hits it with a straight bat. Philander sprints back from mid-off and pulls that back just short of the rope
full on middle and off, defended solidly towards mid-on, and the bowler cuts it off, moving quickly to his left in his follow-through
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
full on off stump, and he comes forward confidently and punches it crisply between the bowler and mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, steered to backward point
short ball on a fourth stump line, lots of bounce, and Ronchi sways away to let it go
back of a length on off stump, and Ronchi gets on his toes and keeps the ball down, steering it down to point
short, rising ball that's angling away on a tight off-stump line, awkward bounce, hits Latham's gloves as he jumps up to try and defend
back of a length, and Latham leaves it on length, and it bounces over the top of off stump
fuller now, on off stump, defended to mid-off. Good stride forward
again extra bounce, this time on middle stump. Latham is on the hop, closes his bat face, looking to play towards midwicket, and the ball runs off the leading edge towards cover point
back of a length again, outside off, and Latham lets the ball go
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Latham stays back and plays with soft hands to drop the ball into the off side and call his partner through for a well-judged single
down the leg side, and he can't tickle this past short fine leg
very full, wrong ball to sweep, and he's hit low on the front pad, but the umpire says not out after Duminy appeals loudly. Good decision by the umpire. That didn't turn and was sliding down leg
short ball, and Latham is back in a flash to pull it away to the deep midwicket boundary
down the leg side once more and this time he clips it away to the left of the man at deep square leg
shortish ball, angling across, and he goes back and slaps it away wide of point
fired full and down the leg side, Latham can't connect with the sweep
tossed up outside off, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, and he slices it uppishly to the left of backward point and the right of third man
short, wide, and that's a crisply timed square cut. Just got on top of the bounce and chopped down over the ball to send it racing away backward of point
brings the line closer to off stump, and Latham looks to punch and the angle away beats his outside edge
tremendous timing. He's such a good cutter. This was reasonably close to off stump, but those hands do such superb work on top of the bounce to time that away to the right of deep point
length ball, angling in towards off stump, and he comes forward and defends into the off side
goes wide of the crease and angles it in towards off. Latham comes forward and simply leans into the ball to send it racing away between the bowler and the mid-off fielder diving in vain to his left
tossed up outside off, and he comes forward and drives to extra cover
pushed through a bit quicker and fuller, and he defends off the front foot into the off side
a little slower now, and he gets on the front foot but lets it come on and dabs it away towards cover point
back of a length, goes with the angle, and he goes on the back foot and defends back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
down the pitch now, nimbly done, and he works it away towards midwicket
full outside off, and he leans into this drive and times it beautifully, races past cover who dives to his right but can't do it quickly enough to cut the ball off
short now,  on off stump, and Ronchi swivels nicely into the pull and it runs away to the straight midwicket boundary
slower ball, angling in towards off, and he gets forward and pushes it into the covers
short again, on middle and leg this time, and the ball makes a lovely sound as it strikes Ronchi's bat as he swivels and sends it scuttling away to the deep backward square leg boundary
back of a length, tucking Ronchi up, and he works it off his hips towards square leg
back of a length outside off, Latham leaves it alone
length ball on the pads, clipped away towards deep backward square leg
short, down the leg side, and Duminy is a lucky boy because he would have got four had he swatted that a couple of feet finer. Instead, McLaren dives to his left at short fine leg and stops that
full now, on off stump, driven towards long-off
tossed up outside off, chipped uppishly over mid-off
full, driven wide of mid-off
back of a length on off and middle, punched off the back foot down to long-on
full and wide, and Latham gets a big stride out to drive it to deep cover point
back of a length on off stump, and he goes back and makes some room to slap that wide of cover, who dives to his left to stop that on the circle
quickish ball on off stump, and Latham comes forward to defend into the off side
quick, angled across, and Latham pushes at it away from his body and gets a thick outside edge that runs away between the keeper and short third man
back of a length, and again it slides on with the angle and this time he looks to cut and gets another thick edge, straight to short third man
fuller now, and he comes forward to defend into the off side
fullish ball on leg stump, driven down to long-on
slants down the leg side again, and he goes back and helps it away to the left of square leg
full on middle stump, defended down the pitch
a little quicker now on middle stump, defended into the on side

what a way to go! He skipped down the pitch and looked to work it against the turn. Almost yorked himself, and ended up jamming the ball into his pad, and it rolled down to the keeper who had loads of time to whip off the bails since Latham was stranded yards outside his crease
quickish ball, full, drifts in from off towards middle, and Vettori defends it back to the bowler
full ball, angled in towards middle stump, defended solidly off the front foot
back of a length on off stump, and he goes deep in his crease to work that towards midwicket
full on leg stump, and Ronchi misses the flick and it runs off his pad towards square leg

gone! Vettori looked to sweep this length ball and missed. It straightened from middle to middle and the umpire's finger went up immediately. He reviewed it, but it was among the plumbest lbws in the history of the game, and it was more in hope than in belief that he reviewed. Was hitting middle stump three-quarters of the way up
read the googly, it was back of a length well outside off, and he let it go quite safely
oooh, nearly another lbw. Inside edge saved him. It was the slider, very straight, and it hurried on as he looked to work it across the line. Shouldn't have gone back to that. Misread the length
quickish length ball on a tight off stump line, defended off the front foot
tossed up wide of off stump, driven down to long-off
looked for the lap sweep and couldn't connect. Initial line would have allowed it but it didn't turn, and ended up hitting the front pad
back of a length, cut away to deep point
back of a length on off stump, defended after going back and across
full outside off, and extra cover dives to his right and gets a hand on the ball to stop that firmly hit drive
quickish length ball on middle and off, defended into the covers
tossed up a little slower, and he comes forward, lets it come on, and dabs it away towards point
sweeps a very full ball from off stump down to fine leg
full and wide, driven to mid-off
full, a little closer to off stump, a checked drive to mid-off
full on leg stump, and it beats him for pace as he tries to flick, hits him on the pad
back of a length outside off, doesn't come on for the punch through cover, and it ends up going off the inside half of his bat towards mid-on
back of a length, straighter line this time, and it hits him on the thigh pad as he looks to tuck it away into the leg side
length ball on off stump, driven on the up and cover dives to his right to stop that
back of a length on off stump, pulled away to deep midwicket
slower ball outside off, and he comes forward to defend
another slower ball, comes forward and jabs it away to the man at deep cover point
googly, and he goes back and pokes it away towards point
another googly, and this time it beats his bat as he looks to cut
fuller now, driven down to long-off
quickish ball, slides on with the angle and hits him on the pad as he plays for the turn. Was going well down the leg side
another googly, and it turns sharply beats his inside edge as he prods forward and ricochets off the front pad down towards third man
quick, full and straight, and he comes forward to block it back to the bowler
back of a length angling down leg, and he blocks it towards midwicket. Didn't come on at all
slower ball, full, and he looks to drive through cover but can only inside-edge it into his pads

what a catch that is! It was short, angling down leg, it was there to pull, but he only got glove on that and de Kock skipped a step to his left as soon as he saw the line of the ball and threw himself into the horizontal to take it at full stretch, one-handed

super bouncer, comes in off the pitch and threatens to knock Mills' head off but he moves his head away just in time. The umpire calls no-ball and one of the fielder says "you must have been a batsman in your time."
muted appeal for lbw as he misses the flick, but it was definitely heading down leg
angles towards leg stump and he tucks it away off his pads down to deep backward square leg
length ball on off stump, and Mills comes forward to defend into the covers
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-off
tossed up even more, and he whips this wristily down to long-on. Slomo shows it was the googly, so he must have picked it out of the hand
quicker and flatter, and he blocks it towards midwicket
another one slides on with the angle as Mills prods forward, and runs away off the inside half of the bat towards square leg
full on middle and leg, blocked down the pitch
quick and flat on leg stump, pushed down to long-on
full on off stump, must have been another slower ball. Looked to drive to mid-off, maybe, and ends up dragging it wide of midwicket. Runs away to the boundary nonetheless
again he looks to drive down the ground off a full ball on off stump, and this time he gets an inside edge that dribbles into the leg side
back of a length on off and middle, defended off the back foot to mid-on
short ball, was there to pull, but Mills ends up hitting it down the throat of the man at deep midwicket. Philander only had to run a few steps to his left to catch that at a nice chest height
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point off the back foot
slower ball wide outside off, driven to deep cover
on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, was the googly. Boult came forward, kept bat and pad close together, and defended into the covers
full on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
googly, too short, turns down the leg side and he tucks it away to deep backward square leg to bring up his fifty
tossed up outside off, whipped down to long-on with a lot of bottom hand
quick and flat, on leg stump, and he skips across his stumps and tickles it away very fine, past the keeper for four
backs away from the stumps and clubs this leg stump ball between the stumps and mid-on
backs away again. Morkel bowls it short, outside off, and he wafts at it and makes no contact
exposes all three stumps and looks to swat the ball square on the leg side. Misses, predictably enough, and the ball is inches from shaving the leg stump
down the pitch now, backing away from the stumps again, and swivels to club that towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, makes room again and jabs it away towards point
backs away again, Morkel follows him with the short ball, and he brings his bat up to fend it away and somehow plays that towards mid-off
Ronchi steps away from his stumps this time, and steers this length ball towards point
back of a length outside off and he pokes at it and pops it uppishly towards mid-off, drops short of a diving Faf, and he decides to take the single
back of a length on middle stump. Boult walks towards square leg, and swivels through a full circle and somehow gets the ball off the toe-end of his bat backward of point
short ball, Boult didn't know too much about that. Simply stuck his gloves in front of his face and the ball was wide enough outside off to sail harmlessly past him
down the pitch, making room all the time, and Steyn bowls the yorker wide outside off
short ball again, and Boult steps away from the line and is safely beaten, pushing his hands at the line a fortnight after the ball had passed him
back of a length on off stump, jabbed away towards short cover

Ronchi makes room and Morkel follows him with a shortish ball. He looks to scoop it over mid-off and gets no real wood on it, and McLaren didn't have too far to move but he started late and had to dive backwards to his left and couldn't get near the ball
shortish slower ball, and he's beaten trying to pull
and again, another slower short ball, and Ronchi is through his shot too quickly
back of a length on the stumps. He tries to make room but doesn't get enough of it and can only defend it back down the pitch
aaaand again. It's short outside off and it simply doesn't come on, and he's beaten trying to pull for the third time in the over
short ball over middle and off, and Boult moves away from the line and is beaten as he tries to fend at it
full, follows Boult as he backs away, and he gets a decent amount of bat on it to drive it towards mid-off
back of a length and it leaves him a little outside off. Poked at it and came nowhere near making contact
a little fuller, a little closer to off stump, and Ronchi moves away to make room and it straightens and bounces extra to beat his outside edge
shortish ball on middle and leg, and he skipped back and across and simply flicked it off his hips to pick it up high and wide of the man at short fine leg. Superb timing
ends the over with a bouncer, and Ronchi ducks under it
backs away towards where a backward short leg might have stood, and the bowler follows him with a full ball,  beats him, but you wonder if he should simply be aiming at the base of the stumps
now he deals with his backing away by bowling short and slow outside off. Boult couldn't have hit that even if he had a bat ten feet long
short outside off, and he only has to skip away from the line to let it go
Greatest. Shot. Ever. Down the pitch, moving away from the line as usual, and Morkel followed him and he swung cleanly through the line to launch that over long-off
short slower ball outside off, and Boult gets nowhere near connecting with that attempted ramp shot

was there a bit of bat on that? The umpire shakes his head, and South Africa review. He backed away again and looked to club it over the leg side. It beat him, or hit the toe end or bottom edge, and passed over the top of the stumps, into the keeper's gloves. No disturbance on Snicko, and no mark on HotSpot
length ball wide outside off, driven to deep cover
length ball outside off, left alone
shortish ball outside off, tennis-forehanded down to long-on
whoa. That was just a touch short on off stump, and Ronchi cleared his front leg and clobbered that over the midwicket boundary
length ball on off stump, and that is exceptional timing. Stayed next to the line of the ball and punched that to the right of backward point and beat deep cover running to his left
fuller now, and he keeps his front leg out of the way, gets nice and low and extends his arms to launch that over the long-off boundary. Lovely clean timing again, and that is the New Zealand 200
and he bowls a short, wide slower ball to start. Boult can only chop it down towards cover
short ball, and Boult sways his head away from the line
pulls this from wide outside off, and nearly takes Ronchi's head off at the non-striker's end. Ronchi ducks and the ball rolls down to mid-on
moved away from the stumps again, and McLaren bowled a length ball down the leg side. He simply hit through the line and lofted that quite cleanly over wide mid-on
looks to pull this slower ball, and is too early into the shot, rolls down to mid-off
this time he stays still and clubs another slower ball down to mid-on
fullish ball on off stump, driven past a diving mid-off, who just got enough of his left hand on it to slow it down and allow the cover fielder to chase it down
shot! It was tossed up, and he made a bit of room and lofted it inside-out over mid-off
shortish googly, on the pads, and he works it away to deep backward square leg
flat and quick, slides on straight, and Boult defends back to the bowler
another slider, on off stump this time, and he defends this towards point
sharply turning googly pitching outside off stump - it actually looked like he bowled that with an offbreak action - and Boult comes forward to defend
slower ball, ends up as a full-toss wide outside off, and again Ronchi finds that gap between point and deep cover
another short, wide slower ball, so wide that Ronchi can't reach it to cut
full on off stump, and he moves across his stumps and punches that down the ground. Long-on slides to his left to stop that
slower ball outside off, and he makes room and chops it down into the ground towards cover point and they run a quick single before the bowler can field that on his follow-through
short, angling towards leg stump, pulled away to the right of the sweeper on the leg-side boundary
that's full on leg stump, and he played the pick-up shot, easy as you like, and it landed right on top of the boundary cushions
full-toss on off stump, clubbed away past midwicket

And he's out for 99. He bowled the length ball, angling in towards off stump, and he sort of stabbed at it, not sure what exactly he was trying to do, maybe run it down to third man, and he only managed an outside edge through to de Kock. Super innings, a pity it ended short of a century

inn2.comm: ooh, that's naughty. Gifts a half-volley on the pads in search for a little bit of inswing, instead offers an easy put away to the fine leg boundary

that's a top shot! Another fuller ball, although this was a decent length and outside off. The kind that the bowler would like, if there had been any swing. There isn't and de Kock taps it down the ground. Pure timing
full and wide, tempts de Kock's drive again and out it comes instinctively. Although he is a little too enthusiastic with this one. Mistimes it into the covers
neatly tucked away off middle stump, another sweet-sounding shot from de Kock
again too straight and that's not the place to be with Amla. Effortlessly clips it away off his pads to deep square leg
good length ball, a littler slower on off stump, defended very solidly

so much for warming up! This is a beauty. Angled a back of a length delivery in and forces de Kock to play, then squares him up with some away movement and by that time the batsman was committed into the shot. The outside edge manifests and Latham picks up a simple catch stomach-high
good afternoon, Mr du Plessis says Boult with a short ball that rises around chest high. The batsman is put in an awkward position and basically fends it down into the ground
back of a length and pushed outside off, du Plessis shoulders arms
good length ball on middle and leg, du Plessis plonks a dead straight bat down on it. Very conscious that he found  mid-on instead of midwicket
some inward movement again, off back of a length. The new batsman is a little lead-footed, but he manages to get the bat down in time to get an inside edge towards midwicket
good length ball teasing the batsman outside his off stump, du Plessis says he won't be a sucker today
shortish on off stump, Amla shuffles across and nudges it towards square leg
full and swinging away, du Plessis is lured by the line to flick into the leg side but gets a leading edge to the full toss
back of a good length and outside off, not bothered with by Amla
goes fuller and keeps the line outside off, Amla sizes it up and hoists his bat skyward again
slid down leg, Amla works it away to deep fine leg. He'd do that in his sleep
full and curling in at the stumps, Faf does well not to get his legs into a tangle. Plonks the front one down, with enough leeway for the straight bat to come down the line. Mid-on mops up
that's well played, gets across on off stump to defend a good length ball that was ducking back in at him
fuller and on off stump, Amla steps forward to block
straying down the pads, Amla looks to clip it away behind square leg again but has moved too far across. Thigh pad helps him get to the other end
that's good pace from Boult, this is 138 kph, and it veers back in at him. No room, rears up towards the splice of the bat. Faf pulls off the bottom hand and defends
shuffles across to protect his off stump and leaves a back of a length ball outside off. Not too far from the target though
that's a terrific ball! This time he beats the batsman with his angle. Gets a shortish ball to rear up and beat the outside edge as Faf tries to punch
full and on off stump, defended stoutly
gets in line with a good length ball on off stump and that defensive bat looks quite broad right now
ohhh, a little nibble away beats Amla's ploy to whip the ball through the off side. How does he go for a drive with his wrists? This time he's beaten though
fullish on middle, Amla is forward to push to mid-on
that's well done, it was a touch too full and Amla gets calmly behind it and punches it to the left of mid-on. Baz from mid-off cuts across and keeps it to a single

gets down the track to try and beat this pitch and New Zealand's discipline, but he can only muster an inside edge. Pulled the pace off that back of a length ball and refused him any room. Very tight bowling here, and it is getting to Faf
good length ball on middle and off, and from that line he gets the ball to shave back in. Faf defends well. And is rewarded with a free hit because the bowler has overstepped
banged in, Faf gets that pesky front leg away and pulls to the deep square leg boundary. But there is protection
full on off stump, brings Faf forward to block. Walks off towards square leg to switch off
back of a length and on off stump, keeps to the crease and defends
good impact from Faf as he lines up a shortish ball that was angled across him, slaps it straight to point though

nips down the track and he's whipped a good length ball away to the midwicket boundary. Looks like he's getting his eye in now, that's a lovely stroke. Good control and placement, because that area was quite vacant and he deliberately hit it over the top
shortish and on off stump, defended quietly
stays put in his crease so he can punch a back of a good length ball towards cover point
not quite short enough for that shot, but Amla has decided he has to put this away. Goes back and pulls and mistimes it. Manages to clear the infield on the leg side though
fuller and outside off, wanted Amla to chase him but he doesn't want to
jags a back of a length ball into Amla quite sharply, but with him staying on leg stump he is able to get bat on ball

that is brilliant timing. It didn't look like it was going to speed away like that, but who am I to decide what an Amla flick through midwicket would do. Neat stroke, but Mills would want his good length balls on the other side of middle stump
full and a shade wide of off stump, Amla launches into a booming cover drive, way too early though, and gets an inside edge towards midwicket
fullish and pushed across the right-hander, Faf says he wants none of it and leaves
back of a good length on off stump, Faf is reliably behind it
short ball on off stump, Faf loaded up for the pull but he didn't have the room for the stroke. Scoring rate getting ot him...
back of a length on off stump, Faf opens the blade to find point
another short ball, and this doesn't have the room for the pull again. In addition it was a touch slower, which dupes a bottom edge to come forth and New Zealand celebrate again.
full and sliding down leg, Rossouw tucks into the freebie with a controlled flick through square leg. Didn't need to keep it down since there wasn't anyone inside the circle
tossed up on middle, Amla gets beside it and drives right through a diving Dan. Sneaks a single down the ground
nicely looped up on off stump, the batsman comes forward to block
length ball on the pads, clipped away through the left of short midwicket
slower through the air, Amla keeps to his crease as he so often does against spin, and cuts to cover point
he's beaten him with drift. It was tossed up and came in at Amla to get the inside edge as the batsman wanted to drive through the off side
another lovely flighted ball on the stumps, Amla went on the drive and was too early on the shot. Gets an inside egde to mid-on
fuller on off stump, with a little nibble away. Rossouw is squared up as he gets a bit of an outside edge to a defensive push
shortish and the movement in slides the ball well down the leg side. Good work from Ronchi diving to his right
good length ball well wide of off stump, Rossouw is lead-footed and slashes. The inside edge is all he manages and the ball thuds into the stump mic and runs away to the fine leg boundary
aggression from Boult as he hammers into the middle of the pitch and gets the bouncer to soar past Rossouw;s left sboulder
back of a length and outside off, Rossouw defends inside the line. Think that's a leave
fuller and outside off, Rossouw goes for a drive on the up and gets an outside edge through the vacant gully region
bouncer, Amla ducks under it and the ump says that had a little too much bounce
fuller and outside off, Amla looks to launch it over extra cover but it seems he hasn't got the pace of this pitch down either. Lobs it over the in-field for a couple
goes on with the arm as Rossouw goes back and punches this to the right of short cover
tossed up on middle and leg, Rossouw nudges it towards the leg side
on the legs and Rossouw gets to the pitch and drives smartly to long-on
stays back and slices a good length ball from off stump, but Boult at backward point does well diving to his left
tossed up on the pads, Rossouw pushes it down to long-on again
flighted on off stump, Amla drives past a diving short cover and gets a single to long-off
quicker, flatter and beats Amla's deft hands. Length ball pushed across the right-hander, almost clipped off stump
tossed up on the pads, Amla turns it to midwicket
backs away to cut a short and quick delivery outside off, isn't able to
flighted on middle and leg, Amla taps it back to the bowler
length ball on middle and off, turned away behind square leg. Vettori's arm tempts Amla, but his partner had slipped at the keeper's end.
slower and good length outside off, invites the punch into the midwicket region
good length and targeting the stumps, Amla gets back and pushes to short cover
waits until the very last minute as he opens the face on a good length ball that skids on with the arm

"caaaaaatch, Jimmy," yells Ronchi! But though he has made good ground rushing in from long-off, he just can't get under it quick enough. This is amazing spin bowling from Vettori, who cares if he's been out of cricket so long. Loops it up and draws the lofted drive, beat him in flight as the ball stays a little too long in the air but the forward-diving effort is in vain
stays back and punches down to long-on
flighted on off stump, gets Amla forward to block
moves towards the leg side to open up the other side, but Vettori gets the flighted ball to slant in and cut the room he tries to create. Bottom edges it down the pitch
good length blal on off stump, Rossouw taps it down towards mid-on
slower through the air and it is a good length on off stump, sliced towards cover point
pushed through on middle and leg as Rossouw opens up and punches down to long-on
waits on a good length ball to turn, very little though, and whips it towards fine leg
tossed up into his toes, Rossouw whips it away through midwicket
tossed up and outside off, gets Rossouw to slash through the covers.  A little uppishly, but no trouble
nips down the track, but he isn't allowed to get under a delivery pushed through outside off
a litlte shortish, but it doesn't have any room. Amla tries to manufacture a cut behind point, but he finds the man
tossed up outside off, driven nicely through the covers.
nicely flighted on middle, squares Rossouw up as he defends and lets the ball run off the open face behind point
looped in on off stump, driven to long-off
oh, you beauty! Dives full-length to his left and reins in a whip down the ground. Danny, you're having a pretty good game today!
nicely tossed up on off stump, Amla tries to whip it with the turn, but there isn't any. Gets a leading edge down the ground
goes back and flicks a length ball through square leg
tossed up on the pads, driven down to long-on
shuffles across to get in line with a length ball on off stump and flicks it towards fine leg
tries to back away to fool the bowler, but NMac's too good for that. Keeps his line on middle and gets the batsman to almost lob a return catch. :Lovely pace from the spinner
flick to midwicket, but the captain's in charge of that region. Good diving save again
good length ball slid outside off, Amla isn't fussed by it and leaves
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
good length ball outside off, tapped away with the open face towards third man
short ball, sat up at his pace and it's been carted to deep midwicket boundary. Guptill is down there, but his full length dive isn't neough
good length on off stump, defended towards point
banged in short and this time he gets some height behind it. Refuses any room too, Rossouw pulls and rolls his wrists on it to square leg
slower through the air and it keeps drifiting on on the pads, too much for Rossouw to flick and gets a leg bye to short leg fine leg
tossed up on off stump, Amla whips it in the air to the right of the bowler though. Remember Nmac is bowling around
short ball, but Rossouw's cut finds cover
waits on his stroke this time and slices the shortish ball through to the sweeper
nips down the track, but he isn't able to flick it past the in-field
tossed up on leg stump, Amla taps it into the leg side

Coooorey Jaayyy! Lures the batsman into a lazy drive on the up and the thick outside edge sails to the lone slip! Poor shot selection there, but that's come about as a result of all the pressure that's been piled on the batsman. It might be drinks as well
fuller on middle, AB nudges it into the midwicket region and gets off the mark straight away
fuller and outside off, Amla drives but again isn't too confident of himself. Checks it and finds mid-off
that's an Amla special! Gets across and whips a short ball from well outside off to deep square leg.
nips away outside off and clips a shortish delivery through square leg again. Another outlandish, but always effective single for him
runs at the bowler and crease a length ball to short cover. BMac won't let that through
tossed up on off stump, pushed towards short cover
loopy delivery on off stump, Amla pushes it down to long-off. Although Baz did try his best to rush to his right and cut it across from short cover
tossed up and lures AB into a drive away from his body, but he does it well and gets a couple to the sweeper
that's short and AB rocks back and cuts behind point
tossed up on middle and leg, Amla turns it away past midwicket
good length ball speared on middle and leg, defended. Ronchi has what he wanted
fuller delivery outside off, Amla drives to short cover. Simple save from Baz
room outside off as Amla shuffles across and punches with an open face behind point
runs at Anderson who tries to one-up the batsman by sliding the ball well wide of his reach. Too much so says the ump
good length on off stump, AB blocks
gorgeous drive to short cover as he meets a fuller delivery with a straight face. Already looking pristine
room again on this fuller delivery and AB steers it past the left of a diving point
jumps across and whirls those wrists of his to send a shortish ball outside off through square leg again. Looks like Amla's going to stick with his strengths no matter what
back of a length and outside off, sliced away to point
gets across on off stump but can only defend a good length ball
cut him in half as he gets a back of a length delivery to nip in off the seam! Amla plays the length and goes for a cut, but he's lucky not to get an inside edge onto his stumps
whips a shortish ball through midwicket
covers all his stumps as he works a good length ball behind square leg

oh, almost. But Amla's canny enough to push with soft hands. This good length ball sliding across him pulled a tentative poke, but the outside edge falls short of a widish slip. New Zealand's bowling has been relentless
full and wide outside off, AB lazily taps it towards short cover
short and wide, AB slashes it to the sweeper on the off side. Watched it so close, waited on it to reach him and timed it nicely
full and wide, Amla shuffles and looks to slice it away through the off side. But doesn't get to it
banged in and Amla gets back and pulls down and in front of square leg
lovely shot! Stands up tall behind a back of a length delivery and directed it to deep cover with immense authority
clips a good length ball away from outside off and deep square leg gets a little more work. He does that way too easily even when he is pottering along
fuller on off stump, tucked away straight of midwicket
allows this length ball to come on to him and taps it with an open face in front of point. This is looking a touch too easy
goes short to try and upset the batsman, but Amla pulls his front leg off the ground and swivel pulls to deep fine leg
fuller delivery, moving a touch away outside off. AB shoulders arms
back of a length with a little more heat, slapped away in front of point but it was a little mistimed
back of a good length on middle, AB is right behind it
back of a good length and outside off, Amla chops it to deep third man
keeps to the back foot to slap a good length ball through to deep cover
good length ball on middle and leg, Amla jumps across and tucks it to mid-on
fuller and outside off, Amla lets it pass. He might have the beard, but he is no Gandalf. And yes, I said that during a match played in New Zealand. Peter Jackson, are you listening?

ohh, he's played on! Good length ball on and around off stump, Amla meets it with an angled bat to get a single towards third man. But all he does is get an inside edge - Mills slower pace and this pitch seem like a match made in heaven - and timber! Scrambled seam does the job
back of a length and outside off, this one though seemed to go through a lot quicker, left alone
whipped off his legs through to deep square leg. Vettori keeps it to one

huge appeal, but the umpire says no. They are discussing a review. 10 seconds, says the ump. They decide not to review. This was a good length ball sliding on with the arm to strike JP on the knee-roll of the pad. Plays for turn, there wasn't any. Eagle Eye says on-field call
turned away through square leg
fuller delivery on middle and leg, AB tucks it away through square leg
gets down the track and tries to work it into the leg side, but he isn't able to beat the infield
gets back, stands up tall and punches a shortish ball through to long-off
shortish and at the body, JP works it off his hips to deep fine leg
back of a good length on off stump, defended
runs down to take a length ball on top of its bounce and slaps it to the left of mid-off. Forehanded it more than anything else, but it was a toe-ender
shortish and outside off, JP gets behind it with a straight bat down to mid-off
good length ball pushed outside off, not bothered with
gets up on his toes and works a shortish delivery from outside off to straight midwicket. Amla was doing the same and getting them to square leg!
tossed up on off stump, defends stoutly
whips a good length ball away from a shade outside off to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, works it away towards mid-on
gets back and punches to the left of short cover, but Baz's acrobatics - he leaps towards the ball - and reins it in with one hand
tapped into the off side again and Guptill hares in to try and effect a run out, but JP's too quick
length ball on the pads, clipped behind square leg
runs down the track, but its a shorter ball. Manages to tap it towards short cover but Baz protects that region too rigorously
slower ball, with a little room outside off, AB gets across and taps it towards third man
slower short ball, JP has spotted it and nudges it towards square leg
shortish and a shade outside off, punched through the covers
nicely driven off the back foot through to long-off. JP hitting his stride, it would seem
full and outside off, AB stays beside it for the longest time and then runs it with the open face to third man
tossed up outside off, AB goes hard at it and slices through point. Possibly mistimed it, hasn't happened too often in this innings
tossed up on middle and leg, JP covers it with a tuck to midwicket
flighted on and around off stump, JP drives to long-off
length ball, pushed through on the pads. AB works it away to midwicket
runs down the track and drives along the turf to long-off
fuller and drifting outside off, AB slices it through the covers and picks up a couple
runs down the track and pushes to long-on
flighted right on the base of off stump, and slapped away through to deep point
length ball on off stump, slapped into the covers
punched down the ground to long-on as this is a shortish ball on middle
keeps to his crease and pushes into the off side
shortish and outside off, sliced away to point
slapped away in front of point. tries to force it and so can only get a single
good length ball on middle, AB runs it with an open face behind point
a little short of the off side, JP cuts it to backward point

runs down the track and flicks it to short midwicket, JP thought he'd got it through and was running down for a single, but has to scamper back as Guptill makes a stunning save and hurls the ball to the keeper. Full-length dive saves JP
gets back and opens the face to punch through to the sweeper on the off side
pushes a flatter, length ball down the ground to long-on
tossed up on middle, AB keeps beside the ball and drives through the covers. Controlled stroke
pushed down the ground, but diving Dan makes another appearance again to save a single
slower on leg stump, JP adjusts and tries to work it through midwicket, but he doesn't have the pace to work with
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off
goes back and taps a good length ball down the ground, Baz steps in from a short midwicket position to stop it
another punch down the ground, but Vettori gets across to it this time
good length ball on middle and off, defended
rauns down the track, Neesh pulls his length back, but AB is ready for that too. Slaps it with a whirl of his wrists to the sweeper
shortish on middle and leg, JP pulls to deep square leg
back of a length on middle, AB jumps back and punches to mid-off
back of a length and a bit outside off, AB tries to do a little more to it than it merited and gets a bottom edge to his cut
lets a short ball come on and taps it gently to deep third man
flighted on off stump, driven through the covers
full on leg stump, and mid-on does well to dive to his right and stop that firm drive

down the pitch now and that's either a bump ball or a catch chipped straight to mid-on. They've gone up to the third umpire, and he's fine. He smashed the low full-toss into the ground and then it bounced onto his pad and lobbed into McCullum's hands.
shortish on leg, punched to long-on
tossed up on middle, keeps his front pad out of the way and drives inside-out to deep cover
slanted wide of off stump, flat-batted drive to deep cover
length ball on the pads, clipped into the midwicket region
back of a length, not enough width to punch, and it rolls gently down to mid-off
shuffles back and across and works this from middle and off to the right of mid-on
looks to tuck Duminy up and overdoes the angle, slants it down the leg side
angles this in, back of a length, and gets it to straighten just a tad outside off and Duminy pokes at it down the wrong line
back of a length again, a little straighter, and Duminy defends off the back foot
a bit of width outside off and he steers it down to third man off the back foot
goes back to this length ball on middle and leg and tucks it away towards midwicket
down the pitch and he works his wrists and puts in a lot of bottom hand to place that, against the spin, to the right of the diving mid-on fielder
down the pitch again and this time he smacks it over the non-striker's head, clean as a whistle
tossed up wide of off stump, much slower, and he drives it down to deep cover
swept from off stump, and square leg dives to his left to stop it
flat and quick on off stump, clipped to mid-on and that will be drinks
leans into a checked drive to mid-off as this was fuller and outside off
back of a length and angled into the body, AB works it away to deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, JP chops it into the covers off the back foot

ohhh, that just about eludes Guptill at backward point. Duminy is surprised by the bounce this gets, rears up at him from back of a length and takes the leading edge off the shoulder of the bat. Closed the face too soon and it lobs up too far to the right of Guptill, despite his dive
good length ball on off stump, driven to long-off
that's an amazing shot! He has dragged a short ball outside off and half-whipped, half-pulled it through midwicket. Such a stable base and such good hands
runs down the track to a slower ball, slashes and misses. Has to run back to ensure the keeper doesn't take advantage
advances again to a length ball outside off and slaps it away to deep cover
gets down the track to a good length ball and taps it to the right of short cover
shortish and outside off, worked away to mid-on
slower and back of a length, tapped away through to the sweeper
good length ball outside off, eased into the covers off the front foot
moves across on off stump to work a length ball to the left of mid-on. NMac rushes in and looks to hurl down the stumps at the non-strikers'. Doesn't and JP had made it anyway
good length ball on off stump, defended
shortish on middle and off, JP tucks it away behind square leg
gets beside a shortish ball outside off and taps it on top of its bounce through extra cover
seeks the yorker on leg stump, doesn't get it and JP is able to flick it to deep midwicket
picks the gap between cover and point as he stays back and crunches a shortish ball outside off
gets across almost outside off and slices a good length ball to point
good length ball, cramping him for room on middle and leg, AB keeps faith in a straight blade
that's his fifty, and what a composed one it has been. Full of dabs, whips and cuts and this time it's a down-the-track launch to the long-off boundary. He has not put a foot wrong
uses his feet again and slaps a good length ball with a little width outside off through to the sweeper
short on off stump, JP moves across and pulls to deep square leg
runs down the track, but NMac has pulled his length back and panics the batsman into playing across the line. Appeal for leg before and it looked quite close, but he was a long way down
stays beside a tossed up ball outside off and slices it to short cover
same shot, but this time he's picked the gap. Half-volley outside off and it had ample room as well, AB says thank you very much with an expansive drive
goes back and taps a shortish, flatter ball through the other McCullum at midwicket. Got a bad bounce off the other pitches
goes back and picks a shortish delivery off his pads to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, JP drives to short cover
he stays on leg stump and slaps a good length ball through to deep cover
looped up on off stump and that enables JP to lunge forward, get down on one-knee and sweep to the right of square leg
moves away outside leg and drives calmy down to long-off
runs down the track and lifts him over long-off. So clean, so smooth, so lovely to watch. He turned the delivery into a half-volley and timed it perfectly
tossed up again, quite slow on off stump, JP advances and is happy with a clip to short midwicket
push towards long-on, but Baz steps in from short midwicket to cut it off
good length ball on middle, AB drives back at the bowler
tossed up outside off, AB slaps it to short cover
flighted on off stump, met with the full face of the bat and pushed past the bowler to long-on
short and wide, JP cuts and gets the ball to the left of point and well to the right of the sweeper. Terrific footwork and placement
runs at the bowler again to get to the pitch of the ball sliding down leg. NMac watches the ball sail away to the wide long-on boundary.
banged in short, AB pulls to deep square leg and seems to have an age to do so. And this is against Trent Boult's bowling
good length ball on off stump, pushed down to mid-on
gets back to a shortish ball outside off and punches it through the covers. That's the 100 partnership. Jeez, already?
moves outside leg, then jumps outside off and flicks a fuller ball through square leg. Looks like he's in finisher mode now. What bets a swept six is around the corner?
advances to turn a back of a good length ball into a fuller one and drives to long-off. Best manipulator of length, field, captaincy in the world?
shortish and a shade outside off, Duminy pull-swipes it to square leg
width offered as Duminy keeps to the crease and taps the ball on top of its bounce to point
on a length and on the body, JP steps forward and across on off stump and swipe it behind square leg

moves outside leg, then gets back outside off. Neesham goes for the short ball which was a good ploy considering AB was set up on the front foot, but he is so set that he is able to hook it away to the fine leg boundary
tries it again, but Neesh sends down another short ball and this one is a little too quick and a bit too high for a the front-foot hook

gets down the track to a slower, fuller ball and whips it to a wide mid-on. Races down to the other end and beats a Boult throw. Well, almost. His wicket was safe, but he does get a nasty hit on the hips from the throw
tucked away into the midwicket region and it's only 23 off 24 now
walks at a back of a length delivery outside off and inside edges it almost to his boot

you little beauty! He has picked up a length ball and smote it down the ground with utmost authority. Cricket's equivalent of a slap on the face. Effortless and dominant. Oh, and that's his fifty as well.
full and outside off, drilled to long-off
good length and outside off, AB eases it through the covers cor a single
shortish and a shade outside off, tapped away to deep third man
length and outside off, AB's crashed through to short cover and a tribute to how hard he has hit is that it pops out of Baz's hands. Single taken
back of a length and around the off stump, AB stays beside it and slashes it away to the third man boundary. Very intentional.
fuller and outside off, AB gets on the drive a little too early and his bottom hand flies off the bat. And yet the ball loops over the off side in-field and races to the cover boundary
banged in short and he gets inside the line to pull towards the deep square leg boundary
a little quicker on middle and leg, AB tries to work it away to square leg again but gets hit on the body

short and sliding well down leg, all AB had to do was help it along and so he does with a wonderfully controlled pull. Scores level, Neesham throws his head back in disappointment. That was a very poor ball
very slow, and a touch short outside off. AB waits on it and slaps to cover. One more over then
thank you, folks. Close the door on your way out! This was full, this was inviting the drive. JP goes one better as he lets his bat go through and launches a six over long-on
